definition: variant of 找茬[zhao3 cha2]
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
fault/glass fragment/quarrel
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking

sentences.english: Anyone who starts picking fights is out at once.
sentences.chinese: 任何找碴打起架來的人就會立刻被攆出去。

sentences.english: Two people started to yell, Jeff han feathers.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人開始對罵，韓志傑找碴。

sentences.english: Don't nibble, I don't want to quarrel with you now.
sentences.chinese: 別找碴兒，我今天可不想和你吵架。

sentences.english: Eg. I was attending to my business, but he picked a quarrel with me.
sentences.chinese: 我在專心幹我的事，他卻向我找碴兒吵架。

sentences.english: Once in a while she fastened a quarrel on her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她偶爾找碴兒跟丈夫吵架。

sentences.english: He is here to pick a fight today.
Most likely, some religious scholar had trailed him home to pick a fight.
sentences.chinese: 極有可能是有宗教學者上門找碴兒來了。

definition: to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to look for trouble
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
deliberately
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
to eat without paying/to freeload
to have bad intentions
to scowl fiercely/to glare
to look for blemishes/to find fault/nitpicking
pretentious/striking a pose
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
